column4: how come when I right click on a folder and select properties and then permission then change the permissions, 'nothing happens'???
Do you have permission to change those permissions?  Are you using gksodu nautilus or something to get root access?
gksudo nautilus                       but be careful .. big tools make for big mistakes
What permissions does it say the folder has now
read only
yes...
thanks
firestarter is not a firewall..  it is an iptable manager.
I understand that, but is there anything better?
guarddog perhaps, or just learn how to setup iptable manually
are you trying to do something specific, or is this a Windows HAngover..
I've used lokkit.  I can also use iptables directly via python.  But its not for me :)
I have a desktop to give out and they didn't like firestarter.  I don't think my choices are very good so I'm seeking alternates
Perhaps you are not explaining it to them well enough .  Most new users are less safe with firestarter or any iptable manager than if they just let the system take care of things by itself
did you check the list of supported hardware to make sure your printer was in there and if people were having problems
well I'm not sure, the drivers are official for hardy, they install fine, but they do not print and I encounter another error with the doc queue as noted.
what make and model of brother printer
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=332224              and    http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=105703
that bcm43 xx chipset seems to have endless revisions/versions
oh, it's that damn b43 chipset.  That explains a bunch.
not for  sure.. but highly suspect that it is
breaking stuff would be my guess :)
